item.title: Rebekah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rebekah add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Rebekah add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Rebekah add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rebekah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rebekah add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rebekah add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rebekah add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Rebekah add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
Rebekah add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
Rebekah add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle." -- Plato

item.title: Rebekah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "He wants them to learn to walk and must therefore take away His hand." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Rebekah add a quote by Emma Smith
item.description: "Strength is not something you have, it's something you find." -- Emma Smith
